course.subject: CENG
course.name: Separation Processes
course.description: Phase equilibria. Ideal and nonideal mixtures. Thermodynamic properties and VLE from equations of state. Liquid-liquid and liquid-solid systems. Stage process, short-cut and rigorous calculations in absorption, distillation or extraction. Continuous contacting processes. Separation sequences. Simulation and design.
course.prerequisites: CENG 2110 AND CENG 2210

reviews.author: LMM
reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.comment_content:
Separation stuff about evaporation, flash, distillation column, adsorption, membrane, LLE, ......
總之好多好多，超級超級多野
內容豐富 資料詳盡 唯一係要上堂聽佢講書上堂內容畀notes多
大致上都唔使上堂因為notes都包含曬所有要考的內容
reviews.comment_teaching:
有video 睇， 務實形式上堂
彩色powerpoint
超有心指導係一個唔錯嘅professor
教得非常之好
有求必答
reviews.comment_grading:
5% assignment
5% participation
15% quiz
20% mid term
5% project
50% final
reviews.comment_workload:
3~4份 assignment
A little project
Funny mid term and final
Easy quiz
好grade
好多人話依科爛grade，B range好闊，應該去exchange trans咗佢
實際又唔係真係咁差
Tom is a one of the best prof.

reviews.author: babycat
reviews.comment_content:
Basically delving into the maths/ calculation behind separation processes as introduced in 2110
Not too obvious connection to 2210, except tie lines and fundamental problem-solving steps
Covered absorption/stripping, filtration, distillation, adsorption, evaporation, multistage extraction
reviews.comment_teaching:
!! Online Sem Alert !!
A little awkward but I can see that he tried to connect with us
Content is dry, which can't be helped, but it does feel like he tried his best
No recordings, had to attend to hear him teach
Lecture notes are uploaded with answers some time after class
Possibly difficult to understand him at times, but lecture notes are sufficient to understand what he is trying to teach
reviews.comment_grading:
5% participation
10% homework (a little difficult for 10% only, but as long as you wrote something, you could get 75%)
25% in-class quiz (backfired on him bc he counted best 2 and a few of the quizzes were easy so it was free 25%)
20% midterm (~40% MCQ, remaining short-answer questions. open book)
40% final (similar to midterm, but more questions so less time to answer all. open book)
reviews.comment_workload:
Average la
Homework is essential to practicing calculation problems, and it wasn't like he gave many questions
He spent tutorial classes guiding us on how to do the homework step-by-step
More than enough time given to finish homework
Optional practice questions provided (to be completed & emailed to TA for grading, answers not directly given)

reviews.author: surgeon70
reviews.title: Good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1: Introduction to separation process
Topic 2: Evaporation
Topic 3: Single equilibrium stages and flash calculations
Topic 4: Distillation of binary mixtures
Topic 5: Absorption and stripping
Topic 6: Liquid-liquid extraction 1
Topic 7: Liquid-liquid extraction 2
Topic 8: Column sizing
Midterm examination (open book)
Topic 9: Rate-based method
Topic 10: Filtration
Topic 11: Membrane
Topic 12 Adsorption
Final examination (online)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Slides are very clear and easy to understand. You can learn everything without attending lectures.
Just ask Tom if you have any question, he will happily answer you.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% assignment
5% participation
15% in-class quizzes
20% mid term
5% project
50% final

Midterm 39/50 Mean 30.9
Final score muted
HW 5.75/6
Project 5/5
Quiz 4.1/6
Participation: Did not go to lectures except for quizzes
A+
reviews.comment_workload:
3 short quizzes
3 HW
1 project (HW using aspen+, very easy)
Expect a lot of calculations and graphs
